intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. micrantha, commonly known as the dwarf sebastiania, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features small, glossy, dark green leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers in clusters, followed by orange-red berries that are a striking feature of the species. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Its ornamental value lies in its compact form, attractive foliage, and seasonal color changes.
